intro: Chthamalia producta, commonly known as the sea holly, is a species of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its bright green, flat thallus with a distinctive lobed structure. This marine alga typically grows on rocky substrates in shallow coastal waters. It plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms. Chthamalia producta is often found in intertidal zones and is adapted to withstand fluctuating salinity and temperature conditions.
